speaker: Patient
text: So, I was thinking, if I miss a dose of the losartan during a busy shift, should I take it as soon as I remember, or just wait until the next day?

speaker: Clinician
text: That's a good question. If you remember within a few hours, it's usually okay to take it. But if it's almost time for your next dose, it's better to skip it and just continue with your regular schedule.

speaker: Patient
text: Okay, that makes sense. I just worry because, you know, with my family history, I don't want to mess things up.

speaker: Clinician
text: I understand, and it's great that you're so vigilant. Just keep monitoring your blood pressure at home, and if you notice any unusual changes, let me know.

speaker: Patient
text: I will. And, um, about the cough I had with lisinopril, there's no chance of that coming back with losartan, right?

speaker: Clinician
text: No, losartan works differently, so it shouldn't cause a cough like lisinopril did. If you do experience any new symptoms, though, just give me a call.
